title: Detections and Analytics
description: ATT&CK can help cyber defenders develop analytics that detect the techniques used by an adversary.

resources.title: Getting Started with ATT&CK: Detection and Analytics Blog Post
resources.description: This blog post describes how you can get started using ATT&CK for detection and analytics at three different levels of sophistication.

resources.title: Cyber Analytics Repository (CAR)
resources.description: ATT&CK is the framework of what adversaries do, and CAR is a knowledge base of analytics based on ATT&CK. This blog post on CAR explains our work to improve it.

resources.title: Finding Cyber Threats with ATT&CK-Based Analytics
resources.description: Presents a methodology for using ATT&CK to build, test, and refine behavioral-based analytic detection capabilities.

resources.title: CASCADE
resources.description: This MITRE research project seeks to automate “blue team” work, including running analytics.

resources.title: ATT&CKing the Status Quo Presentation
resources.description: The latter part of this presentation provides an introduction to using ATT&CK to create analytics. Slides are also available.

resources.title: ATT&CKcon 2018 presentations
resources.description: Many people in the ATT&CK community are doing excellent work with analytics and detection. We encourage you to take a look at these presentations for ideas.

title: Threat Intelligence
description: ATT&CK gives analysts a common language to structure, compare, and analyze threat intelligence.

resources.title: Getting Started with ATT&CK: Threat Intelligence Blog Post
resources.description: This blog post describes how you can get started using ATT&CK for threat intelligence at three different levels of sophistication.

resources.title: ATT&CKing Your Adversaries Presentation
resources.description: This presentation covers how to use ATT&CK to take cyber threat intelligence and operationalize it into behaviors that can drive relevant detections.

resources.title: Blog posts on threat intelligence
resources.description: These blog posts explain the fundamentals of how to use ATT&CK for threat intelligence.

resources.title: ATT&CKing the Status Quo Presentation
resources.description: This middle part of this presentation provides an introduction to using ATT&CK for threat intelligence. Slides are also available.

resources.title: ATT&CKing with Threat Intelligence Presentation
resources.description: This presentation provides perspective on how to use threat intelligence for ATT&CK-based adversary emulation. Slides are also available.

resources.title: ATT&CK Navigator Use Case for Threat Intelligence
resources.description: This demo provides an overview of the ATT&CK Navigator as well as a threat intelligence use case for how to compare group behaviors. A corresponding written tutorial on comparing Navigator layers is available here.

title: Adversary Emulation and Red Teaming
description: ATT&CK provides a common language and framework that red teams can use to emulate specific threats and plan their operations.

resources.title: Getting Started with ATT&CK: Adversary Emulation and Red Teaming Blog Post
resources.description: This blog post describes how you can get started using ATT&CK for adversary emulation and red teaming at three different levels of sophistication.

resources.title: Do-It-Yourself ATT&CK Evaluations to Improve Your Security Posture Presentation
resources.description: This presentation explains how defenders can improve their security posture through the use of adversary emulation by performing their very own ATT&CK Evaluations.

resources.title: APT ATT&CK - Threat-based Purple Teaming with ATT&CK Continued Presentation
resources.description: This presentation takes a deep-dive into using ATT&CK for purple teaming, including lessons learned from ATT&CK Evaluations.

resources.title: To Blue with ATT&CK-Flavored Love Presentation
resources.description: This presentation provides a red teamer’s perspective to show how ATT&CK is a valuable tool to help red and blue teams work together to improve their defenses. Slides are also available.

resources.title: Finding Cyber Threats with ATT&CK-Based Analytics
resources.description: Presents a methodology for using ATT&CK to build, test, and refine behavioral-based analytic detection capabilities.

resources.title: Adversary Emulation Plans
resources.description: To showcase the practical use of ATT&CK for offensive operators and defenders, MITRE created Adversary Emulation Plans. We previously released a plan for APT3 (as well as an accompanying field manual) and anticipate that we will release additional plans in the future.

resources.title: CALDERA
resources.description: CALDERA is an automated adversary emulation system that performs post-compromise adversarial behavior within Windows Enterprise networks. It generates plans using a pre-configured adversary model based on ATT&CK. This presentation from BSides Charm provides an overview of CALDERA.

resources.title: Threat-based Purple Teaming with ATT&CK Presentation
resources.description: This presentation discusses how purple teams can use ATT&CK as a common language for adversary emulation. Slides are also available.

resources.title: ATT&CKing with Threat Intelligence Presentation
resources.description: This presentation provides perspective on how to use threat intelligence for ATT&CK-based adversary emulation Slides are also available.

resources.title: ATT&CK Evaluations Adversary Emulation Summary
resources.description: This summary from the ATT&CK Evaluations website provides an introduction to how ATT&CK Evaluations used an adversary emulation approach.

title: Assessment and Engineering
description: ATT&CK can be used to assess your organization’s capabilities and drive engineering decisions like what tools or logging you should implement.

resources.title: Getting Started with ATT&CK: Assessments and Engineering Blog Post
resources.description: This blog post describes how you can get started using ATT&CK for assessments and engineering at three different levels of sophistication.

resources.title: Lessons Learned Applying ATT&CK-Based SOC Assessments Presentation
resources.description: This keynote presentation discusses a process to gauge a SOC’s detective capabilities as they relate to ATT&CK, including MITRE’s practical experiences and lessons learned.

resources.title: Lessons Learned Applying ATT&CK-Based SOC Assessments Presentation (recording)
resources.description: Youtube recording of the same SANS keynote presentation.

resources.title: ATT&CK Evaluations
resources.description: MITRE’s evaluations of cybersecurity products using an open methodology based on ATT&CK can help end users understand how commercial security products detect known adversary behaviors.

resources.title: Finding Cyber Threats with ATT&CK-Based Analytics
resources.description: Presents a methodology for using ATT&CK to build, test, and refine behavioral-based analytic detection capabilities.
